website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking to stream video on your Android device anytime and anywhere, Amazon Instant Video offers reasonable prices and a wide variety of programming, especially if you're a Prime member.
pros: Amazon Prime members get free   streaming with select content
cons: Even Prime members still have to pay for most content
Season pass not available for all shows

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality picture good price & reliable.
customer_reviews.text: What a package, super mix of films and stuff, far more content than most others and a lot less cost, new stuff added on a regular basis so you don't get to a point where you have seen it all. Overall a superb package well worth it, definitely worth the price and more than competitive with all others inc sky which we have just ditched after several years . You can pause rewind and even come back tomorrow and carry on where you left off. Brilliant quality inc full had and 4k on some stuff. Been using for nearly a year now and still very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Mick

customer_reviews.title: Not happy,
customer_reviews.text: sign into my account, does not work, says put in code shown into computer, and will work,....On computer, now here to place code......have managed to do it on the Firestick. Also not happy unable to download Music onto my Smart phone,keeps saying cannot link Phone go to Amazon Music/settings/manage., still not working , For which i am paying £12.66.
customer_reviews.author: dave the rave

customer_reviews.title: excellant quality
customer_reviews.text: Not as much to choose from as some other services but cannot complain what there is for the quality from a smart samsung 65" tv it's excellent, 4k uhd can lack contrast, so needs tweaking, but hd quality is very good. Sound is sometimes not so clear depending what you are watching. but considering it comes with Amazon Prime delivery service which i give 5 stars i can't complain.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Thomas Jull

customer_reviews.title: Does not stream football on ipad
customer_reviews.text: App works fine for most content. Went to watch the Everton game tonight and just get a playback error. No error code just “oops it doesn’t work”. Works fine on PC on same network so not a buffering error. Good job it’s free because I’m not paying for this crap.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Cartwright

customer_reviews.title: What has amazon done to amazon video forward and rewind buttons
customer_reviews.text: I switched my prime on today and the lay out is different, which is absolutely fine. But what on earth have you done to the forward and rewind buttons? If I forward something it jumps REALLY far and the video reel isn't loading. This has only been since whatever changes have been made and it really isn't user friendly. Also, check out the RIDICULOUSLY small size of the subtitles. If this carries on, I will cancel my subscription. You are supposed to be trail blazers in the tech world, who is checking this stuff?
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: OK app, I was expecting more
customer_reviews.text: Having tried it on 3 different devices for a few days now I can say it's OK to use but, from a company like Amazon, I would have expected better. It seems that it's not buffering videos at all (e.g. like YouTube which is always downloading a bit extra video) so any glitch or delay on the Internet stream are shown during the play. Also the navigation is not obvious and I find difficult to access last movies seen and so on; browsing and searching on TV could be helped (like for YouTube) by pairing a smart device like tablet for fast typing and browsing, then play on TV with a single button.
customer_reviews.author: Massimo Gaetani

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money they are charging
customer_reviews.text: For the amount they are charging the free films are utterly appalling. To add to this you also have to pay extra to join other film groups and subscribe to them. If it wasn't for the grand tour I'd have scrapped this a long long time ago!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lana

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be a bit better.
customer_reviews.text: Good to have. Much more choice than Netflix. Also there isn't the constant repetition that you find in the original content of Netflix, where the next show is just like the last show. The shows and films are more original and innovative. The original content is generally excellent. The interface could be made a bit easier to navigate, via sub-genres, but it works. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: David Strong

customer_reviews.title: Good choice, poor subtitles.
customer_reviews.text: I watch a lot of TV shows, but too many have out of sync subtitles. It's not our broadband as my sister and daughter have the same problem. We need them as my husband is very hard of hearing and gets frustrated at the subtitles and we often have to turn them off, which means he can't enjoy the program. Also, too many shows and movies have none at all.
customer_reviews.author: Angel

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but I would like to see more TV for my prime money
customer_reviews.text: The file/app itself is pretty large which takes up alot of space on my android device & android tablet it comes in just under 200MB (most of my other apps are around 10MB or less I have also get amazon video app installed on my samsung tv and it does not always load. I would expect Amazon to spend more time on developing this side seeing that they are happy to charge £79 per year, so lets see some more tv for my money. Lots of the films are old and the choice is not exactly brilliant.
customer_reviews.author: Mr S

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly easy to use and large free selection of a wide range of things to watch.
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly easy to find a film that looked interesting and watch it. I've signed up to a year of prime and so have Amazon Video as part of the deal. Its an add on I didn't get around to trying when I trialed prime a while ago but now I've tried it I can see us using it as a family often. Films are sorted so that you can just search free to watch ones and then by genre. I haven't yet tried, but intend to now, the download and watch later option which will be fab for the children on car journeys and when flying.
customer_reviews.author: LiveLifeToTheFull

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars: 4 stars for content, 2 star for user interface, (zero for the android app)
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars for content, 2 stars for user interface, zero for the android app. The android app made me check my calendar to make sure the year was 2017 and not 1997... I really like the original content, but the navigation makes is very bad. Why do you need to load every sub page? Comparing to Netflix Amazon Prime Video UI is years behind.
customer_reviews.author: R.E.

customer_reviews.title: iOS 14 incompatible - AVOID
customer_reviews.text: I would love to rate it 4 star because it used to work but it is incompatible COMPLETELY with iOS 14 (both prime video & prime music)
customer_reviews.author: Billand Bhen

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: I love Prime Video, I have it across all my devices. Just one yearly fee which a much better deal than Sky. You get great choice of movies, a lot of them free and some great series. I never watch normal TV I use I watch Prime everyday. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara OHare

customer_reviews.title: The quality of amazon prime originals is fantastic, from Man in the high castle
customer_reviews.text: This is well worth having. The quality of amazon prime originals is fantastic, from Man in the high castle, Bosch, The Americans to Lucifer to name but a few. There are films and TV shows plus some items which you can pay to rent. But there's so much choice from Amazon Prime that you'll never be bored. You can playback on any device with the amazon video app making it completely versatile. Totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Caz

customer_reviews.title: Watch the series called " last man on earth" it's so funny
customer_reviews.text: Had no idea that I bought this item until it appeared on my bank statement. Bank told me they hear this all the time. They bill you near xmas for a year. Oh yes. However there's good news. There's some great stuff to watch like X-FILES & last man on earth series 1-2. Movies are ok too. So yes they tricked me out of the subscription via a free postage thing. But it's turned out ok. I've had my money's worth over new year period. Better than pub, fireworks, mince pies and stupid hats. Tuck yourself in bed and watch a scary movie lol
customer_reviews.author: moshibenisrael

customer_reviews.title: Prison Break, Downton Abbey, Amazon video has it all.
customer_reviews.text: If you like the look of just one series on amazon video you might as well get it for a month. There are so many movies and shows to watch in high quality and you get the benefits of amazon prime as well. Honestly just get it for Downton Abbey and Prison Break.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Feels like being short changed
customer_reviews.text: We pay money every month yet not everything is watchable why we got to pay extra to watch something’s every thing should be included in your monthly payment another way to bleed money out of you and another thing you’re supposed to keep adding films not taking them off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like it, the video played very well on my ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, the video played very well on my Android device, I'm on a poor signal (1 bar) 4G, and because it wasn't HD quality it could play without buffering, no stopping or staggering. Please Amazon be aware that some users don't have WiFi, or a fast 4G connection so a choice of resolution video quality playback would be great as a setting. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: lico

customer_reviews.title: Great original series
customer_reviews.text: Some excellent original series included in your subscription , Goliath being one of them , great that you can download them and watch them off line , intend to do this on my next flight . I'm only on the free trail , not sure I would pay full price £79 a year even though it includes prime 1 day delivery as been let down a few times with that , perhaps if you can sign up by the month maybe .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why can't you cast without having to but a devise?
customer_reviews.text: Fed up watching on my phone, I refuse to buy a devise to cast to my tv, my smart tv is not compatible with Amazon app , why you can't cast direct from phone like you can you Tube I do not know? Oh yes I do know, more money for the company ! Already pay for the service, sort it out Amazon, you're not that far behind the ability to cast direct like You Tube surely?
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the month free trial so you can decide whether this is for you or not.
customer_reviews.text: Only Just started this with a months free trial. I am fairly impressed so far...... BUT..... Disappointed with the fact that on a shared household account it doesn't allow others to receive prime music which is an excellent part of the package. Also not too happy about some of the films/TV episodes are pay per view/episode. I would prefer they were not there and every one I look at I can watch without having to pay more. Not sure yet if I will continue after my month trial.
customer_reviews.author: Janet from yorkshire

customer_reviews.title: let down by technology
customer_reviews.text: Trying one of these online video services for the first time, "because it's there" mainly. It's good in terms of content I saw advertised, I looked for one series only which I knew was there, but there's loads of other stuff to choose. But to view movies and TV I can only use a smartphone not a tablet,and the tablet is good(Galaxy Tab2). This is a limitation that's close to being a showstopper, hence it loses 2 stars. I want to relax while I watch that sort of stuff on a decent size tablet screen, not shrunk onto a smartphone no matter how brilliant the resolution (HTC M8). And as for two watching it together it's difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs a price comparison feature.
customer_reviews.text: A good app if you have Prime video. Its a little basic but it does help you to browse what is available on your phone or tablet. But its not good for viewing any content as you cannot login to your account using the app. Most annoyingly, it does not display the prices for those films and videos that are not included in Prime. This would have been useful in making comparison decisions on whether to stream or buy a DVD / BluRay.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Stewardson

customer_reviews.title: Better than most programs that are on tv at present
customer_reviews.text: I used the virgin prime channel to start then I used my fire stick, I only wish I had tried it sooner, I watch the first 5 episodes of jack Ryan and found it to be intoxicating, found it hard to turn of as I like a good story line.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Crandon

customer_reviews.title: Great service but limited due to location.
customer_reviews.text: Only because I'm living in Ireland, not all features are available without streaming through a website, needed additional apps etc to watch certain videos. Amazon prime in general is great but limited due to my location, that's the only reason I gave an overall rating of 3 Stars
customer_reviews.author: Paul Nesbitt

customer_reviews.title: On the right Tracks...
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad this is finally here. Though I'm a little dubious of the "Only our app store" situation, and why it's needs a separate app (then bounces back and forth between the Amazon store and the Prime App... Playback is good. Seems to be no issues though options are a little lacking and where settings are changed could be a little clearer. As others have said, This is still missing on Chromecast and Roku (uk)... this would be a much smarter investment to bring in the Prime Subscribers. I know Fire TV is here but don't punish the early adopters...
customer_reviews.author: Lofty

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this app much more than Netflix app, especially the ability to fast forward ten seconds. Only downside is the watch list feature - I find it strange that seasons of a show are bookmarked individually, rather than the show as a whole. But not a big problem!
customer_reviews.author: Justine N. Stefanelli

customer_reviews.title: Amazon prime members
customer_reviews.text: Amazon prime is nice to have the tv shows are good and the movies i havent watched a movie yet but looks good collection and the benefit of next day delivery on amazon buys is nice but the only down side is if your into tv shows is you get with prime season 1 - 3 or something like that then you want to whatch season 4 then you het hit with £19.99 for that season so just beware of that other than this its nice forgot to say you also get music its ok but the good content cost money
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Much more content than Netflix
customer_reviews.text: Lots of things to watch and buy if you like to keep them. I would like to be able to alphabetise my watch list and also to be told which series or movies will be leaving Amazon soon so I can watch those ones first. Other than that it is a really good service.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper then Netflix .... And it shows.
customer_reviews.text: A lot of content, some good series on the service but no good if you are looking for newer films, takes ages for the big titles to appear unless you want to rent or buy them at additional cost, Searching is a chore and not at all simple, especially with the Fire TV Stick, Netflix is better but Amazon is cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Bloke in Bristol

customer_reviews.title: Great streaming service!.
customer_reviews.text: A great service which gives so many different things to stream, films, programs, box sets, I have thoroughly enjoyed my membership so far!. I would recommend this service to anyone good value for money!.
customer_reviews.author: GrahamCh63

customer_reviews.title: Quality service at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent service and quality of service, well worth the price more do when you compare to the likes of SKY TV, I mainly use the service on my phone for watching films etc when travelling with work and its superb.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Mc

customer_reviews.title: Old rubbish movies
customer_reviews.text: Lots of movies that should not have been released for public viewing some of the acting and filming is so bad it hurt my eyes and ears if you are going to use this service please read reviews of every movie before pressing play to save you from wasting your time
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Won't download to SD card
customer_reviews.text: The product appears to work OK. My initial interest is to download movies for holiday travel. This works fine, but I cannot find a way to download/transfer to the SD card. Opening the app the option to move to SD card is grayed out (not available). I see no reason why this is. My free satnav enables me to move all maps to the SD card. Thus only a 3 star rating. If this option was available, I would be happy to give it a 5 star. If anyone can advice how to get the "downloads" to the SD card, I'll re-star.
customer_reviews.author: Viking

customer_reviews.title: Overall very pleased. Quality playback
customer_reviews.text: Overall very pleased . Quality playback . Occasional sound glitch. Surprised at their being charges to view certain items after paying the membership fee. Some of these are quite high .. equivalent to buying the series on dvd. I believed that joining would reduce my spend on dvd's now I am not so sure . It is also irritating that on some seasons e.g. season 3 Vikings you can watch the first few episodes but then have to view an episode a week . May as well be watching normal TV! However there is a decent selection of free content to keep me entertained for ages ( as I've never had Sky TV etc ).
customer_reviews.author: TKH

customer_reviews.title: All the big box sets like Game of Thrones
customer_reviews.text: Not that much content included in Prime. Most of the media listed is chargeable. All the big box sets like Game of Thrones, Breaking Bad, Sopranos is not included. Mainly got Prime for Hand of God which was OK. The rest of their "original" content is mediocre. On a plus side, the app is reliable and works well on the TV. Not sure if I will renew.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. M. J. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids. No Disney films. Option to download offline. 4*
customer_reviews.text: Love Amazon prime video. Mostly bought it for the grand tour. Slightly disappointed with the selection of videos. There's very little if any at all of Disney films. There must be some law whereby they can't have them. Lots of old films and a few new films. The repository will get better I assume with time. Lots of stuff for the kids and lots of TV shows if you have time to watch them all. Also great option is you can download and view the shows or films offline so as to not use data. Watch them when commuting or something.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother if you're using Android!
customer_reviews.text: Whilst this app is laid out nicely and is relatively easy to use, the streaming quality leaves much to be desired. The sound is just fine, considering it's being listened to via a tablet but the film quality which should be SD (like a dvd, not a blu-ray) is very patchy and blurry. I've seen 1940's black and white films look superior in quality in comparison! This is likely due to the shockingly slow frame rate. I would not recommend this for any Samsung Android tablet which is what I have, but my Husband assures me that it looks far better on his Apple iPad. I have deleted this app which a real shame.
customer_reviews.author: TheLunaFaerie17

customer_reviews.title: I don't recommend Prime
customer_reviews.text: I'd had LoveFilm membership previously, and I thought this would be the same, only with streaming. There were lots of old and really old films that I'd always wanted to see, and they were all on LoveFilm. However, the selection of films with Prime was nowhere near as extensive, to the point that it was not the same at all. However, I'd got into watching Grey's Anatomy and loved it, so I paid for membership after my trial finished, only for Grey's Anatomy to be removed less than a month after I took the membership. I like Prime delivery, but not enough to pay £80 for it.
customer_reviews.author: A11150n

customer_reviews.title: A great app
customer_reviews.text: A great app to stream and download Amazon videos. I love the very easy user interface, including the ability to get informations on actors etc... (x-ray) and the ease to watch/resume watching from multiple devices. Seamless ! Only criticism is that you cannot download to the SD card on the phone and this is making the extra memory space useless whilst my phone is running out of memory. I assume this must be something to do with copyright protection as it is otherwise a glaring omission. Otherwise I love this app.
customer_reviews.author: jfb

customer_reviews.title: Good, but still room for improvement...
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I didn't really think we would use Amazon Prime Video when we ordered Prime primarily for the Delivery aspect. Since getting it, we've ended up watching all 4 seasons of Vikings, numerous films, and have just started watching Bosch. It would improve if there were more blockbuster style films, perhaps ahead of DVD release included - even if it was 1 per month. There is something for everyone, and I'm looking forward to the Grand Tour and Season 2 of Lucifer.
customer_reviews.author: H. Walker

customer_reviews.title: need to pay for programmes and films but good variety
customer_reviews.text: can watch all kinds of films and programmes but many have to be paid for, especially if you don't have prime. amazon are making a lot of programmes and films too which are mainly good
customer_reviews.author: Mrs B

customer_reviews.title: ... for a while and I was really enjoying and happy to have it
customer_reviews.text: Had for a while and I was really enjoying and happy to have it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seperate subscription option for amazon music
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to install. Wanted to stream to googlecast but this app won't let you do that which is annoying. I would have to buy fire stick which I am not about to do. This is why I won't be renewing prime because too limiting on what you can watch Amazon video on. Don't want to watch on phone as screen too small to enjoy anything on. I would prefer Amazon music alone. I Don't watch Amazon video much as I prefer Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: colette

customer_reviews.title: Dont allow casting.
customer_reviews.text: I think its very poor by today's standard to not be allowed to cast video content. Read up on it and it's a gripe between Amazon and Google basically and Amazon dont care hurting their subscribers. Will be cancelling my subscription so. Good luck and thanks.
customer_reviews.author: ebennova

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but...
customer_reviews.text: While "Content is King" metadata comes a close second, and without a comprehensive search function all the content in the world is useless, if you can't find the kind of thing you're looking for!
customer_reviews.author: Therion Tiberius Ware

customer_reviews.title: Can't download...
customer_reviews.text: I have an unlimited data bundle, but the app does not allow downloading shows on anything other than wi-fi. As others have said, lack of Chromecast support is very annoying. Update: trying to download over home WiFi, and keeps failing saying I don't have enough storage. Android settings say I have 30gb internal and 50gb external storage remaining, so I don't get the problem. Also tried adding a new 60gb SD card (formatted as internal storage) and it made no difference.
customer_reviews.author: Ravi Patel

customer_reviews.title: Good picture on TV so far.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to watch WTA Tennis on TV and although I have not yet had the opportunity to watch live matches the repeat events seem fine. I am a sports fan and the other benefits of Prime do not interest me very much.
customer_reviews.author: David Alefounder

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Excellent app. My one huge criticism (that lost the app a star) is the inability to set up the app for children in my family. Despite having an "Amazon Household" with my kids added - the app can only be used by other "Adults" - which is in part due I suspect to its having paid content that requires bank details. I dont want to be a naysayer entirely - so Ill say that what I really like is the ability to download to watch off line. Great app, maybe a bit of a tweak off perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Adair

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Prime is good and use it at different times. When I first started using amazon prime film the fms were great a few years on and not much has been added especially with newer films unless you want to buy or rent them.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend highly, but all new releases/season's should be free to all prime members!
customer_reviews.text: The Amazon app is good, only criticism is, after watching the prime box sets or season's, If not complete you then have to pay for the new season just released. Either in full, or for each episode separately, Which I think is a little unfair considering the yearly membership... Maybe that's just me.. other then that everything is good would recommend!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs A Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Prime Instant Video - not really usable on Mobile phones.
customer_reviews.text: Only works on Android mobile phones, what's wrong with Android Tablets? It's more likely someone would want to watch a film on a Tablet with a larger screen, than a mobile phone? Also, it is very battery and resource hungry.....I started to watch two episodes of Spooks on Sunday (approx. 1 hour each) and when I started had 95% battery. It ran out of battery before the 2nd one had finished. I tried plugging in the charger when warned how low battery was, but then got an additional warning saying too much power was being used and it couldn't charge, try turning off apps !!! Un-installed the whole app, as it's not really fit for purpose......
customer_reviews.author: LDunnett

customer_reviews.title: A lot of promise but a pain to view
customer_reviews.text: For reasons I don't fully understand, it works ok on my laptop but it's a real pain getting it to work on my android tablet. Surely it should be slicker and easier without needing to install apps within apps? I have to say I was disappointed as there is a lot of great content and I just wanted an easier way to view it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: A decent attempt at becoming a netflix rival
customer_reviews.text: Good selection of content but hate that in order to get access to some shows and films their is a additional cost that the subscription does not cover
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even better now you get Prime Music as well as the ...
customer_reviews.text: Even better now you get Prime Music as well as the postage benefits. And the Kindle lending library. But the promotional credits you get for not choosing next day delivery - seriously that needs to be tracked in Amazon itself, it's really hard to know when it will be applied or not and what the expiry dates are! And impossible to work out if what you're buying will get the discount or not. And I still have no idea quite how it works in terms of how much discount is applied and when. I also dislike that if you aren't using a Kindle based tablet, tv series episodes don't automatically start playing when one finishes.
customer_reviews.author: Laddy

customer_reviews.title: The Grand Tour Season 3 Episode 14
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoyed the final episode about the Ford Cortina, Sierra and Mondeo with Clarkson, May and Hammond. only issues with minor buffering on one or two occasions at most and not for any prolonged duration quality of video very acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: ciccers

customer_reviews.title: I like it but the menu system needs to have options ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it but the menu system needs to have options to remove items that you have watched, don't watch or maybe you don't want subtitled films to just show up with english films.
customer_reviews.author: MR EC ALDER

customer_reviews.title: Allows you to download films to watch later offline when you don't have an Internet connection!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely brilliant! I've just downloaded it and discovered that you can now save films to your mobile or tablet for offline viewing! Yes you can download when you've got an Internet connection and then view anywhere - planes, trains, auto-mobiles, ships, camping in the back of beyond - literally anywhere so long as you've still got some battery life left. Of course it helps if you've an Amazon Prime account so that you can watch movies for free, but then who hasn't these days?
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: All together a good service, let down a little with dated (not the most recent) or 'B' movies selection.
customer_reviews.text: Nice service however movies and films are not always the most recent and there are a lot of 'copy' or 'B' type movies but at least this allows some variety. Sky show more up to date movies or have them available before they even appear on here. The TV series service I feel seems better with more cutting edge up to date Television or exclusive to Amazon series and selections. Overall I like the service and the link to 'next day delivery' on my Amazon Prime orders. All together good service
customer_reviews.author: nmh

customer_reviews.title: 3 downloads to get the app needed for video playback on Android what anightmare.
customer_reviews.text: Amazon please what a nightmare to watch Amazon video. First you have to download one app which enables you to download another and on the 3rd download you finally have the app to watch videos. What's with having to download Amazon Underground ect We need to be able to just hit the Play store for Android and download the app from there sheesh.
customer_reviews.author: FLAMinEK

customer_reviews.title: User experience on PlayStation is catastrophic
customer_reviews.text: I watch this on my PlayStation and it is dire. Scrolling forwards or backwards is a hit-or-miss affair from back in the 80s, because you can never tell where you are (unlike Netflix). When you pause, the information bar does not disappear, hiding a large part of the screen. I love (the ludicrous) Lucifer and I might enjoy (quirky) Preacher TV series, but it's hard going watching them on Amazon Prime. I wish these series were on Netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Biggie Smalls

customer_reviews.title: Put your customers before your ego.
customer_reviews.text: Great app on the platforms that amazon allow it to run on however amazons failure to to put customers first and allow development off the app for non amazon products, i.e nvidia shield is very disappointing. Even more disappointing is that Amazon has developed the app for the sony tvs running android tv which the shield uses however they will not allow the app to be used on other android tv devices. Put your customers before your ego and you will compete with netflix.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Begley

customer_reviews.title: Terrestrial TV is dead.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have a television as Igot bored of the rubbish served up on it for a lot of money. There were series that I wanted to watch and it was between Amazon Prime and Netflix. I plumped for Amazon, as I was a member of their marketplace, and I couldn't be happier with the choice. Will definitelt re-new when the time comes. Brilliant service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Still no Android tablet support so remains a poor alternative to Netflix...
customer_reviews.text: Until Amazon, owners of LoveFilm, pull their heads out of their behinds and properly cater to the hundreds of millions of Android owners, they'll only ever be second best to Netflix and/or dodgy torrent downloading. Only works on my HTC M8 but not on my tablet. And without a Chromecast option, I'm unlikely to subscribe beyond the free 30 day trial. A weird bunch Amazon. On the one hand they've revolutionised online shopping, on the other hand their streaming video business plan is inexplicably short sighted. Three stars at best. Fairly good content but poor platform support and delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Howcroft

customer_reviews.title: Amazon video
customer_reviews.text: Amazon Video gives you a lot.of choice anf is very good The only downside is that it is not easy to get the app for your smartphone but once.you have installed it its great to have on your smartphone i have reduced the number of stars because when i veiw amazon video throratherugh my new smart dvd with wi fi the picture quality is very poor like an old vhs tape. I was expecting HD quality so rather dissapointed with the quality when veiwing on a large HD screen
customer_reviews.author: Mr R Strong

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how much I'd use it, but it is already a firm favourite - now on series 4 of Ripper Street with a whole bunch of other series and films queued for viewing. We're watching Sky a lot less and terrestrial TV hardly at all. Hopefully the PRIME included selection will continue to grow. Nice interface on TV / Phone / Tablet / PC, superb quality and no issues at all with streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Carr

customer_reviews.title: Not a good enough customer experience at the moment
customer_reviews.text: I have both Netflix and Amazon instant accounts and I think Amazon you need to review your library. The range of especially newer movies isn't great. Also expecting me to pay membership as well as fees for certain videos isnt great customer service. With Netflix I pay one fee and then everything is free. I was originally a love film customer so that's the only reason I still have your service. The biggest issue you have at the moment is your streaming interface. So slow...lots of buffering...its simply not good enough.
customer_reviews.author: VJ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Can download and watch content offline anytime love this feature. Good quality videos and lots of shows to watch
customer_reviews.author: Dpzzz

customer_reviews.title: GREAT APP  -  WOULDN'T BE WITHOUT IT
customer_reviews.text: This app is amazing, can watch everything I want with no buffing etc. Such a clear picture on all videos. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Broadhead

customer_reviews.title: A complete waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Rubbish. Anything worth watching has a "rental" price associated with it and everything else is sub par compared to other well known movie providers. I didn't even want Prime in the first place, I took the trial month then these cheeky gits charged me for a year anyway, right at Christmas too when I needed the money the most, so thanks for that. A complete waste of time, effort and money. I would avoid Amazon prime video like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: Rob S.

customer_reviews.title: Pathetic
customer_reviews.text: A great service it's a shame, google and amazon have to be so pathetic that their services are incompatible. Through what must be deliberate design. The prime video android service is unavailable on Play store and Google chromecast feature not working on either chrome browser to tv or via android, when playing prime video content. It's just so pathetic, like two school children; 1) you can't have my... 2) well you can't have my.. Grow up you're both multinational companies
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but needs work
customer_reviews.text: Generally it is a good service, and seems to work well on the PC, but the smart TV version of the streaming app seems to repeatedly crash, I assume it is because the streaming is slow???? I think the app for smart TVs (Panasonic) needs to be a little more resilient like Netflix. Content is good. The only comment I would make be is that perhaps Amazon Prime needs to be separated on the PC from the Amazon sales site proper, as it can be a little confusing and enter into a program search and viewing site.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Good companion to Netflix
customer_reviews.text: I watch both Netflix and Prime Video. Not a wide selection of material for my taste but there are hidden gems like Angel, The Marvellous Mrs Maisel, Justice League Unlimited, American Gods, etc. Worth the Amazon Prime subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Fatman

customer_reviews.title: I have a hearing impairment and this is annoying, usually I use google play
customer_reviews.text: I have talked about this in another review, slight niggles for me were the 2 programmes I bought didn't have subtitles, I have a hearing impairment and this is annoying, usually I use google play, advantages of which are that (normally) programmes have subtitles, you can download them (e.g. to watch on the train) and you can watch them on tablets (I know now this works on tablets, but it didn't when I got it). while I'm going to stick with google play, I still check for things on Amazon first, if I'm not bothered about downloading, as sometimes they are cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this app. I will be honest I bought it to watch The Grand Tour but have found it invaluable and great value. I have a monthly subscription and it works well for me and I think its good value for money. I am in hospital the last few weeks and have loved the great variety of movies and shows. They are fairly well up to date and in great quality. Could benifit from weekly updates for movies but that is only a small thing. Also enjoy being able to download programmes from a series and watch them back to back. As you can tell I really like this app and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Package!
customer_reviews.text: Love it, so much to do . I'm still in my free trial but will be definitely subscribing. I'm always on prime for films and TV programs. Plus the other advantages of Prime Music, Photos, Reading, free next day delivery. Very satisfied have nor been disappointed yet....
customer_reviews.author: Salma Hussain

customer_reviews.title: Amazon video
customer_reviews.text: first time i have tried this,i have started to watch Mr Robot, never heard of it before,it looked interesting and now im hooked. luckily i was able to start right from the begining series one and can progress to series 2 when i want, im really happy with amazon video. there is a good selection and you are not ltd by time. easy to use as you can mirror from your ipad to your tv. but you need to down load the App to do it this way.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: How to ignore the majority of Customers!!
customer_reviews.text: Where is Android Video for Windows based machines, I have a perfectly good laptop, why on earth would i want to watch a film on my phone, regardless of the 5" screen and excellent sound, I want to use the service I pay for properly and yet I am frustrated by the myopic thought process of Amazon. Please, for Christ's sake, join the 21st century and make the ability to watch programs and movies offline available to those who have real screens...
customer_reviews.author: Jim Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Can't use on tablet, bad for the bed bound disabled.
customer_reviews.text: Received a new tablet for Xmas, have come to update it so I can continue to watch Amazon and it is unsupported. I am disabled and spend a lot of time in bed, laptop is not convenient for me as its likely to get broken if I fall asleep watching and I don't have a tv in the room. I now can't watch what I pay for unless I am well enough to sit in the lounge. Poor judgement, considering cancelling my subscription because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Shaw

customer_reviews.title: i love the fast delivery options or same day delivery
customer_reviews.text: I have been using amazon video now for about a month. There is still a lot of improvement to it but it works well. i love the fast delivery options or same day delivery. I only wish there was more choice of videos and movies on prime video which are included which is the reason i brought this for. Considering you pay for the subscription to amazon prime, there isn't a lot of choice until you pay to buy or rent the movie or TV series.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: App is good, movie choice not great
customer_reviews.text: Downloaded as an addition now I have amazon prime - moer for the postage and upcoming 'Grand Tour' - but the app seems fine. Shame about the selection of movies, takes about 20 minutes to find anything worth watching! Usually end up with something I've never heard of that might be OK...TV shows I haven't started on as I don't want to end up addicted to something and lose all my spare time! looks like there's some good stuff on there though.
customer_reviews.author: J. Palliser

customer_reviews.title: Beware of charges at the end of series
customer_reviews.text: Excellent range of videos but a very irritating habit of including most of a series and then charging for the last episodes get customers hooked and then charge them, a bit mean!!!!
customer_reviews.author: val lewis

customer_reviews.title: A 50-50 mix of great and poor films ... but still great.
customer_reviews.text: Some good stuff on Prime Video! If you just need to watch a film now and then you don't need Netflix too. The Man in The High Castle is amazing - watch it!
customer_reviews.author: deep_learning

customer_reviews.title: Good for a break from Netflix.
customer_reviews.text: Not as competitively priced as Netflix. Even have to pay to rent some REALLY old films! However, if you've ran out stuff to watch its not bad & has a different selection. I have found streaming to be better than google too.
customer_reviews.author: Ballentinems2

customer_reviews.title: More flexible parental controls needed
customer_reviews.text: Would love it if there was a way to restrict the visible library to a certain age, rather than just blocking the ability to watch/purchase certain shows and films based on their age rating. It's good that I can stop my kids watching Deadpool and Ripper Street etc, but I'd prefer it they didn't see the thumbnails for those shows etc at all. Netflix has the ability to do this with it's Kids mode, but it's not an option here.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Net flix has better free choice
customer_reviews.text: Net flix has better free choice included in subscription. I don't like how you can easily purchase premium streamed video's/dvd/discs and the press of a button without having to put password in. Not good to leave logged in on the childrens TVs xbox's etc. Best thing is the Prime 1 day deliveries. Which I will probably take a subscription out for next Xmas. I did purchase a Premium streamed movie which was good and actually cheaper than virgin media, +point. But theres other non subscription services that we could do that with.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. F. Malia

customer_reviews.title: Rubbish. Update. Now I'm angry... UPDATE...MUCH IMPROVED! YA!!
customer_reviews.text: I had movies thrust upon me as I had been a Prime customer for years. At first it didn't work on any of my Android devices. Then suddenly, it worked on my TV box. Now with this update, it fails again. Now works on my phone. But who wants to watch a movie on their phone, with a huge TV in front of them? Amazon...get it sorted!!! Update 22.12.15. Seems to be sorted out now. Playes on Android devices and mirrors to Chromcast on TV, much happier Update to 4 stars. 5 when buffering skips are improved.,
customer_reviews.author: Finfeature

customer_reviews.title: Good streaming service with lots of choice for everyone
customer_reviews.text: signed up for this back when it was love film and just kept it going. I have now cancelled my lovefilm account but am taking up Amazon Prime to get the free delivery as well as video. PROS Good selection of tv programs and films CONS No profile option (like to keep my series separate to other members of my family) The app on my tv likes to show videos that aren't covered by my prime account so will cost me (just need to change search type everytime I look) All in all a good alternative to Netflix
customer_reviews.author: Didgestar

customer_reviews.title: Faultless tv on the go!
customer_reviews.text: Really good app, in my opinion, better and more easy to use than sky go, better choice in film too!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Video (Prime)
customer_reviews.text: Although I have a smart TV (Phillips 40PFL8007) it does not have the Amazon App (thus far at least) but I do have a PS3 & PS4 which does have the Amazon App. The streaming and visual qaulity is excellent. For me at least there is plentty to watch particularly when there is nothing of any interest on my Tivo Box. If I had any complaints then it's simply that after going back and forth to various pages/screens when browsing the app sometimes gets ponderous and Images for Films?Programmes stop appearing
customer_reviews.author: LadyRynn

customer_reviews.title: It would be nice if it didn't do that
customer_reviews.text: When watching a show, and turning the device screen off for a while, the app loses connection, and then takes you to a "download" screen the next time you use the device. It would be nice if it didn't do that, and just left you on the show screen which you were already on. Another thing that would be good is if it remembered the state of the "scrollers" on the main "shows" page so that when you click on a show to view more details, and then go back, you don't have to scroll through all the shows again
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Ok, with some caveats.
customer_reviews.text: Ok. One day delivery is good, music not bad, films etc. a bit average with a less than wonderful selection of titles. Getting an app shortcut onto an android device is a bit " round the houses" and as yet unachievable on my Asus Chromebook flip. Prime Day is worth paying attention to! The continual desire to sell you stuff does get a bit wearing after a while, but I guess that's not just on Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Worth It.
customer_reviews.text: I used to pay monthly because I wasn't overly sure of it, we already have Netflix, however the Music is awesome, I haven't searched a song that I cannot find, it's like a jukebox to my life. With it the Prime Delivery is great, not having to wait around to get the products, prime really does make all the difference.
customer_reviews.author: James Reilly

customer_reviews.title: That tatty old video shop down the road is now online...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty useless really. The free Prime video collection is exactly like walking into a tatty old Blockbuster video shop. You scan the shelves seeing masses of straight-to-video crap and other tired old movies, wondering if there is actually anything decent to watch. And if you do find anything, it's not in the free Prime section - you'll have to pay for it. Prime is simply not worth the money considering the poor content and we will not be renewing it. If Amazon halved the yearly subscription we might be interested.
customer_reviews.author: Reaction

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: So easy to set up & use, I am 50 anf a bit of a technophone so if I can do it anybody can - I lead a busy life so getting a wee watch of something to relax at the end.of the day is priceless - so far everything I have searched.for is there - so happy
customer_reviews.author: Gabrielle Pickering

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Lovely I just wish there was a bit more free films to watch
customer_reviews.author: Monika

customer_reviews.title: Could be better but has some okay shows
customer_reviews.text: I like some of the shows on here but doesn't seem to have as good a range as Netflix. Also the user interface is just ridiculously bad, it occasionally changes but never for the better. I've also struggled streaming and downloading on any other device that isn't a computer.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Disapoited
customer_reviews.text: hi there I have just joined amazon prime( more importantly amazon prime, to my disappointment a movie that I so much love, the last time I watch it I was 10 yrs old, today I am 36, I don't understand why AMAZON put a voice over or add a voice over into such a special movie, STUPID, its annoying PLEASE AMAZON REMOVE THE VOICE OVER Regards
customer_reviews.author: T Djalo

customer_reviews.title: Better than Netflix
customer_reviews.text: I bought Amazon Prime initially for The Grand Tour, but it has been so much more than that. There are so many good tv series on there that I have shamefully binged on loads of them. Included in the package is the next day delivery which essentially pays for the TV service. The only thing I don't like is the new menu, it is almost a direct copy of Netflix menu, (and I don't like that one either). The previous menu wasn't perfect, but it was better than this one. So only 4 stars I'm afraid.
customer_reviews.author: Alan
